"The future is bright and we're just getting started," Ime Udoka says.

Jayson Tatum says, "If you win a championship, they can debate a lot of things, but they can't debate whether or not you're a champion."

Jayson Tatum's stance on the on-court exchanges so far in the series: "At the end of the day, it's basketball. You've gotta understand what certain people are trying to do to get you out of the game ... I enjoy that competitive part."
Ime Udoka's advice to the team on partaking/not partaking in trash talk on the court: "Be who you are. If you want to ignore it, ignore it. If you want to engage, engage."
#NEBHInjuryReport Ime Udoka says Robert Williams is fine after taking a fall during Game 2. He says Williams stayed down on the floor just to make sure he was OK before continuing to play.
